channel.title: Unable to run GS
channel.description:
Having trouble launching the GS with stock settings, nothing changed.
This is what happens when I use Rodgerwilco's repo version which used to work before for me. I am using Windows 8.1 x64 with scala 2.11.0, ant 1.9.4, and JDK 1.7.0_55.
[code][ivy:retrieve] :: retrieving :: org.moparscape#MoparClassic [sync] [ivy:retrieve] confs: [default] [ivy:retrieve] 0 artifacts copied, 39 already retrieved (0kB/16ms)
build: [scalac] Compiling 2 scala and 205 java source files to C:\Users\marwood\Docu ments\GitHub\MoparClassic\GameServer\bin
run: [java] Missing tile: h0x48y37 ex: 10, 10 [java] 2014.05.09 09:11:12 No config file specified. [java] Defaulting to use conf\world.xml [java] Missing tile: h0x48y38 ex: 10, 58 [java] Missing tile: h0x48y39 ex: 10, 106 [java] 2014.05.09 09:11:12 Loading world. [java] Missing tile: h0x48y40 ex: 10, 154 [java] Missing tile: h0x48y41 ex: 10, 202 [java] Missing tile: h0x48y42 ex: 10, 250 [java] Missing tile: h0x48y43 ex: 10, 298 [java] Missing tile: h0x48y44 ex: 10, 346 [java] Missing tile: h0x48y45 ex: 10, 394 [java] Missing tile: h0x48y46 ex: 10, 442 [java] com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException: java.lang.IllegalStateException : Expected BEGIN_ARRAY but was STRING at line 1 column 2 [java] at com.google.gson.Gson.fromJson(Gson.java:806) [java] at com.google.gson.Gson.fromJson(Gson.java:734) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.gs.persistence.impl.JsonDataStore.load(Unk nown Source) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.gs.persistence.impl.JsonDataStore.load(Unk nown Source) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.gs.persistence.impl.JsonDataStore.loadDoor Defs(Unknown Source) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.definition.EntityHandler.<clinit> (Unknown Source) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.gs.io.WorldLoader.loadSection(Unknown Sour ce) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.gs.io.WorldLoader.loadWorld(Unknown Source ) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.World.getWorld(Unknown Source) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.gs.Instance$.getWorld(Instance.scala:15) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.gs.Instance.getWorld(Instance.scala) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.gs.Server.main(Unknown Source) [java] Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Expected BEGIN_ARRAY but was STRING at line 1 column 2 [java] at com.google.gson.stream.JsonReader.expect(JsonReader.java:339)
[java] at com.google.gson.stream.JsonReader.beginArray(JsonReader.java: 306) [java] at com.google.gson.internal.bind.ArrayTypeAdapter.read(ArrayType Adapter.java:70) [java] at com.google.gson.Gson.fromJson(Gson.java:795) [java] ... 11 more[/code]

item.title: Unable to run GS
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Github.com’s windows GUI application is glitchy and doesn’t play nicely with all files and corrupts some. Using the official git application for checking out and cloning solved the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Unable to run GS
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Looks like some of the JSON data files got messed up somehow. Like Rodgerwilco said, try the official repo, it should be working just fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Unable to run GS
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Replace the landscape?

Try the official repo

Read full topic
